page.title: 08THE RIVER THAMES AT ERITH.
page.content: From our school we have a good view of the river which is half a mile wide and flows from west to east. It is now very clean and over one hundred species of fish including salmon have been caught. Many boats pass the school, including barges, colliers, launches, tugs and containers. There are many wharfs and different works beside the river. One paricular wharf is for roll-on_roll-off paper. It is the second deepest wharf in Britain. The stretch of water opposite the school is called Erith Reaches and it separates the London Boroughs of Bexley and Havering. A lot of rubbish found in the Thames is unloaded at the G.L.C. warehouse at Coldharbour Point. We are lucky to be so near the river.
